sen.j: 衣笠山（きぬがさやま）は、京都市北区 (京都市)にある山。
sen.e: Mount Kinugasa-yama is located in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
Mount Kinugasa-yama is located in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.
Mt. Kinugasa is located in Kita Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 第59代宇多天皇が、真夏に雪景色が見たいと衣笠山に白絹をかけた故事から、別名「きぬかけ山」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Mount Kinugasa-yama is also called Mount Kinukake-yama after the story that 59th Emperor Uda, who wanted to see snow scene in midsummer, covered ('kake') Mount Kinugasa-yama with white silk ('kinu').

Mt. Kinugasa is also called Mt. Kinukake after a story about the fifty ninth Emperor Uda, who wanted to see snow in midsummer, covered ('kake') Mt. Kinugasa with white silk ('kinu').
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。"fifty-ninth Emperor→""the fifty ninth Emperor"に変更しました。

sen.j: 周囲は、金閣寺、仁和寺、龍安寺などの名刹に加え、京都府立堂本印象美術館や立命館大学などといった文化・教育施設に恵まれ、多くの観光客で賑わう。
sen.e: Mount Kinugasa-yama is surrounded by renowned temples such as the Kinkaku-ji Temple, the Ninna-ji Temple and the Ryoan-ji Temple, as well as cultural and educational facilities such as Kyoto Prefectural Insho-Domoto Museum of Fine Arts and Ritsumeikan University, thus attracting many tourists.
